meanings.sent1: I like to compartmentalise my toys into different boxes.
meanings.sent2: She tends to compartmentalise her work tasks to stay organized.
meanings.sent3: It's funny how I compartmentalise my snacks into separate containers.
meanings.sent4: Her mind seemed to compartmentalise the information like a filing cabinet.
meanings.sent5: Compartmentalising my thoughts helps me focus better.

meanings.definition: Separate into distinct parts or sections.
meanings.sent1: He will compartmentalise the puzzle pieces before putting them together.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to compartmentalise the different topics for the essay.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally compartmentalised my socks into two different drawers.
meanings.sent4: The artist's work seemed to compartmentalise emotions into vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: Compartmentalising the ingredients made cooking the dish easier.

meanings.sent1: She will compartmentalise the documents into folders for easy access.
meanings.sent2: It's important to compartmentalise the tools in the toolbox.
meanings.sent3: I tend to compartmentalise my thoughts into different mental boxes.
meanings.sent4: The architect compartmentalised the building design into functional areas.
meanings.sent5: Compartmentalising the closet made finding clothes simpler.
